abstract.p: Computer Associates International Inc reports sharp drop in quarterly earnings, to $138 million (S)

block.p: Lower Quarterly Income For Computer Associates

Computer Associates International Inc. (NYSE: CA) of Islandia has reported that its quarterly net income dropped to $138 million, down sharply from last year's same-quarter earnings of $334 million. The company said that income was affected by reduced global demand for mainframe software and a softer market in Europe.
Earnings were 54 cents a share, compared with 75 cents in the previous year's quarter.
Lower Quarterly Income For Computer Associates

Computer Associates International Inc. (NYSE: CA) of Islandia has reported that its quarterly net income dropped to $138 million, down sharply from last year's same-quarter earnings of $334 million. The company said that income was affected by reduced global demand for mainframe software and a softer market in Europe.
Earnings were 54 cents a share, compared with 75 cents in the previous year's quarter.
Record Quarterly Results For Symbol Technologies

Symbol Technologies of Holtsville credited record third-quarter results to the success of a series of new products introduced since June 1998. Revenue for the third quarter ended Sept. 30 was $373.2 million, up 27.4 percent from the prior year. Net income for the quarter was $40.5 million, or 28 cents a share, a 31.5 percent jump.
L.I. Commercial Bank Net Income Rises 25%

The Long Island Commercial Bank's holding company, the Long Island Financial Corporation (Nasdaq: LICB) has reported a 25 percent increase in net income, to $475,000 or 30 cents per share, for the quarter ended Sept. 30. Last year, the company reported a net income of $381,000, or 22 cents per common share, for the quarter. A spokesman attributed the increase to improved net interest income, additional fee revenues and new electronic banking services.

Two East End real estate companies, Zorn & Sons of Ronkonkoma and Wine Services Inc. of Riverhead, plan to develop an 80-acre industrial park in Yaphank. The park could contain a maximum of 600,000 square feet. . . . The First Priority Group Inc. (Nasdaq: FPGP) of Plainview reported earnings of about $100,000 for the third quarter on sales of $3.9 million, bettering its original profit estimate. By contrast, the company lost $215,000 in the same period last year on sales of $2.7 million. First Priority offers fleet management services and wholesale insurance products.
